item.title: Pat Gelsinger wants to save Moore’s Law, with a little help from the Feds
item.dc:creator: Connie Loizos
item.description: The company is aiming to produce its first silicon wafers by 2028 and have its first commercial system online by 2029.

item.title: Meta reportedly delays mixed reality glasses until 2027
item.dc:creator: Anthony Ha
item.description: aMeta lready sells VR headsets and Ray-Ban smart glasses, but these new glasses sound a bit different. Their format factor would reportedly be similar to the Apple Vision Pro, with a puck-like power source.

item.title: Is it time to ‘refound’ your startup?
item.dc:creator: Anthony Ha
item.description: Sometimes, founding a startup just once isn’t enough.

item.title: How would the Netflix-Warner Bros. deal reshape Hollywood?
item.dc:creator: Anthony Ha
item.description: It’s only been a day since Netflix announced an $82.7 billion deal to acquire Warner Bros., and the acquisition has already been described as sending Hollywood into “full-blown panic mode,” “possibly a death blow to theatrical filmmaking,” and maybe even “the end of Hollywood” itself.

item.title: Creator IShowSpeed sued for allegedly punching, choking viral humanoid Rizzbot
item.dc:creator: Dominic-Madori Davis
item.description: Creator IShowSpeed sued after punching, choking viral humanoid Rizzbot.

item.title: After you check out your Spotify Wrapped 2025, explore these copycats
item.dc:creator: Lauren Forristal, Ivan Mehta
item.description: Spotify’s annual Wrapped feature just dropped, giving listeners a fun, personalized summary of their listening habits. It has gained immense popularity over the years, and as a result, many companies have seized the opportunity to create similar year-in-review experiences, offering users a recap of their habits, preferences, or interactions from the past year. Here are […]

item.title: Digital artist Beeple put his face on a $100K robot dog next to Elon Musk and Picasso – it sold first
item.dc:creator: Connie Loizos
item.description: The project marks at least the second time Winkelmann has become the art world's main character.

item.title: Ex-Googler’s Yoodli triples valuation to $300M+ with AI built to assist, not replace, people
item.dc:creator: Jagmeet Singh
item.description: Yoodli counts Google, Snowflake, and Databricks among its customers.

item.title: Sources: AI synthetic research startup Aaru raised a Series A at a $1B ‘headline’ valuation
item.dc:creator: Marina Temkin
item.description: The one-year-old startup, which does market research on simulated populations, had a multi-tier valuation round, sources tell TechCrunch.

item.title: Waymo to issue software recall over how robotaxis behave around school buses
item.dc:creator: Kirsten Korosec
item.description: The voluntary recall comes as scrutiny by federal regulators and local school district officials increases.

item.title: AWS needs you to believe in AI agents
item.dc:creator: Theresa Loconsolo
item.description: AWS announced a wave of new AI agent tools at re:Invent 2025, but can Amazon actually catch up to the AI leaders? While the cloud giant is betting big on enterprise AI with its third-gen chip and database discounts that got developers cheering, it’s still fighting to prove it can compete beyond infrastructure.  This week […]

item.title: Feds find more complaints of Tesla’s FSD running red lights and crossing lanes
item.dc:creator: Sean O'Kane
item.description: The National Highway Traffic Safety Administration has identified at least 80 incidents.

item.title: This startup built a Fitbit for your brain to combat chronic stress
item.dc:creator: Marina Temkin
item.description: Forenza collaborated with data scientists and biomedical engineers to develop Awear, a small device worn behind the ear for continuous brainwave monitoring. The device transmits results to an app, which provides information about the wearer’s mood and offers AI-powered coaching advice for managing stress and improving emotional resilience.

item.title: SpaceX reportedly in talks for secondary sale at $800B valuation, which would make it America’s most valuable private company
item.dc:creator: Connie Loizos
item.description: The eye-popping figure reflects how routine mega-valuations have become in private markets.

item.title: Meta acquires AI device startup Limitless
item.dc:creator: Sarah Perez
item.description: Limitless said it shares Meta's vision of bringing personal superintelligence to everyone.

item.title: ChatGPT’s user growth has slowed, report finds
item.dc:creator: Sarah Perez
item.description: ChatGPT's global monthly active users only grew by around 5% from August to November, while Gemini's users grew by about 30%.

item.title: AWS re:Invent was an all-in pitch for AI. Customers might not be ready.
item.dc:creator: Rebecca Szkutak
item.description: AWS is releasing a lot of new AI tech, but the cloud infrastructure giant's enterprise customers may not be ready for it yet.

item.title: eSIM adoption is on the rise thanks to travel and device compatibility
item.dc:creator: Ivan Mehta
item.description: As a technology, eSIM has been around for a decade now. However, global eSIM adoption was around 3% last year and will only cross 5% this year. Despite these figures, analysts, eSIM-providing startups, and investors are bullish about eSIM's upward trajectory, largely thanks to travel.

item.title: New ‘KnoWay’ robotaxis cause chaos in upcoming Grand Theft Auto Online DLC
item.dc:creator: Sean O'Kane
item.description: The inclusion of the Waymo look-a-likes appears to be part of a larger storyline that will encourage players to "stop the development of a mass surveillance network."

item.title: New streaming channel launches to give viewers a peek into city council meetings
item.dc:creator: Dominic-Madori Davis
item.description: Hamlet TV is a way to help keep citizens informed of what's happening inside local governments.
